wikitext.*:
Dr '''Alison Milbank''' is Associate Professor at the Department of Theology and Religious Studies at the University of Nottingham, lecturing in Literature and Theology. She is also an Anglican Priest.<ref>[http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/news/expertiseguide/experts/m/dralisonmilbank,associateprofessor.aspx Dr Alison Milbank, Associate Professor] at [http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ Nottingham.ac.uk] (accessed 25 December 2011)</ref><ref>[http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/press/Chesterton_and_Tolkien_as_Theologians.php Interview with Dr. Alison Milbank author of ''Chesterton and Tolkien as Theologians''] at [[Tolkien Library]] (accessed 25 December 2011)</ref>

*[[2003]]: ''[[The Lord of the Rings and Philosophy]]''
**"'My Precious': Tolkien's Fetishized Ring"
*[[2008]]: ''[[Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings – Sources of Inspiration]]''
**"Tolkien, Chesterton, and Thomism"
*[[2013]]: ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: the Forest and the City]]''
**"Tolkien and Dante's Earthly Paradise: Enculturing Nature"
